intro: Dipcadi fesoghlense, commonly known as the Fesoghlense buttercup, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Fesoghlens Mountains. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
